body_html:
tf-slim.data can decode jpeg, png or raw see here

The only caveat is that it needs to know that the encoded image has png format when creating the tf-example.
When you created the dataset did you specify the image was a png? So for instance the flowers dataset assumes that the images are jpg
body_text:
tf-slim.data can decode jpeg, png or raw see here
The only caveat is that it needs to know that the encoded image has png format when creating the tf-example.
When you created the dataset did you specify the image was a png?  So for instance the flowers dataset assumes that the images are jpg
body:
tf-slim.data can decode jpeg, png or raw see [here](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/slim/python/slim/data/tfexample_decoder.py#L269)

The only caveat is that it needs to know that the encoded image has png format when creating the [tf-example](https://github.com/tensorflow/models/blob/master/slim/datasets/dataset_utils.py#L56). 
When you created the dataset did you specify the image was a png?  So for instance the flowers dataset assumes that the images are [jpg](https://github.com/tensorflow/models/blob/master/slim/datasets/download_and_convert_flowers.py#L145)
